bib.title: Production of Fe-52 via proton-induced reactions on manganese and nickel

SD: REACTION code was updated according to
Cross-sections and radionuclide yields were calculated
from the measured emission rates of the characteristic
gamma-rays of the relevant activation products, making
use of the decay data tables of Reus et al. (1983).
All yields were corrected for decay losses during and
after bombardment, and are therefore reported as
Corrections for the decrease in beam current due to
nonelastic nuclear interactions as the beam traversed
the stacks were taken from the tabulation of
Janni (1982) while the energy degradation in the stacks
was computed by means of the stopping power expressions
/By authors/ The total uncertainties in the cross-
sections and production rates were obtained by
summing all the contributing uncertainties in
quadrature and were expressed with a 1 standard
For irradiation, the foil stacks were mounted either
in one of the standard Faraday cups used for beam
diagnostic purposes in the NAC external beam lines,
or in a simple, more easily accessible stack holder
at the end of one of the beam lines.

These foils also served as monitor foils for the
accurate measurement of the incident proton flux.

required, was accomplished by means of suitable Al
